Package main

Class NodeHeap

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.CLILogger
      • main.NodeHeap
  • public class NodeHeap
extends CLILogger
    A Min Heap to manage priorities of nodes. Assumes that upon creation, all distances of nodes in the graph are positive infinity, except for one starting node with distance 0.

    Lowest distance in graph instance means highest priority.

    • Field Summary

    • Field Detail

      • graph

        private Graph graph
        Graph instance the nodes of which are represented in the heap.

      • heapNodes

        private int[] heapNodes
        Contains node indices from graph. Represents the heap, so item 0's node has lowest distance of all.

      • maxIndex

        private int maxIndex
        Maximum index used in graphNodes array. Items beyond are not considered part of the heap anymore.

      • nodeLocation

        private java.lang.Integer[] nodeLocation
        Entry n contains the index under which node n from the graph is currently found in heap's array heapNodes[].

    • Constructor Detail

      • NodeHeap

        public NodeHeap​(Graph graph,
                int startingNode)
        Construct a NodeHeap instance. Starting node is automatically added to heap, others have to be added with addNode() while having infinite distance, e.g. when found in Dijkstra's algorithm.
        Parameters:
        graph - The graph to work with.
        startingNode - the starting node

    • Method Detail

      • resetHeap

        public void resetHeap​(int startingNode)

      • decreaseDistance

        public void decreaseDistance​(int node,
                             double newDistance)
        Decreases the distance of a node in the original graph, then restores heap condition if necessary.
        Parameters:
        node - Index of node from the graph that gets new distance.
        newDistance - Will be written in graph object.

      • addNode

        public void addNode​(int node)
             throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Adds the given node to the heap, unless it already exists. Distance value in the graph must be Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY when using this method - use decreaseDistance() to set a new distance later.

        The heap can only contain as many nodes as specified upon construction, which must be numbered between 0 and the max amount minus 1

        Parameters:
        node - Index of node in the graph.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if node ID is not between 0 and the amount of specified nodes minus 1.

      • contains

        public boolean contains​(int node)
        checks whether a node has been added to the heap previously.
        Parameters:
        node - Index of node in the graph.
        Returns:
        True, if node exists in heap.

      • siftDown

        private boolean siftDown​(int heapItem)
                  throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        If necessary to maintain the heap property, sifts down an item.
        Parameters:
        heapItem - will sift down if associated node distance is greater than any child's
        Returns:
        true, if sift was necessary.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • siftDown

        private boolean siftDown​(int heapItem,
                         double distanceOfNode)
                  throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        If necessary to maintain the heap property, sifts down a an item.
        Parameters:
        heapItem - will sift down if the associated node distance is greater than any child's
        distanceOfNode - (optionally) the current distance for this item's node.
        Returns:
        true, if sift was necessary.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • siftUp

        private boolean siftUp​(int heapItem)
        Sift up a node, if necessary to acquire heap condition.
        Parameters:
        heapItem - will sift up if associated node distance is less than its parent's.
        Returns:
        true, if sift was necessary.

      • siftUp

        private boolean siftUp​(int heapItem,
                       double distanceOfNode)
        Sift up a node, if necessary to acquire heap condition.
        Parameters:
        heapItem - will sift up if associated node distance is less than its parent's.
        distanceOfNode - (optionally) the current distance for this item's node.
        Returns:
        true, if sift was necessary.

      • getParent

        private int getParent​(int heapItem)
        Returns the index of the parent item in this heap. Will return 0, if the item's index is 0, as the root has no parent.
        Parameters:
        heapItem - - the parent of this item will be returned.
        Returns:
        index of parent, or 0 for root item

      • getLeftChild

        private int getLeftChild​(int heapItem)
        Returns the index of the item's left child, if it exists. Returns -1 if not.
        Parameters:
        heapItem - index of item on the heap

      • getRightChild

        private int getRightChild​(int heapItem)
        Returns the index of the item's right child, if it exists. Returns -1 if not.
        Parameters:
        heapItem - index of item on the heap

      • getPositionOf

        public int getPositionOf​(int node)
        Parameters:
        node - a node from the graph
        Returns:
        current location of the node in the heap. -1 if out of bounds

      • swap

        private void swap​(int item1,
                  int item2)
        swaps two items in the heap. Does not maintain heap property!

        also updates location info for the associated graph nodes in this.nodeLocation[]

        Parameters:
        item1 - index of first item
        item2 - index of second item

      • getTopElementsPeek

        public java.lang.String getTopElementsPeek()
        Returns:
        a String containing the top 7 nodes in the heap separated by comma

      • removeRoot

        private int removeRoot()
        removes and returns the root item and determines a new one. Does preserve heap property. Returns -1 if no items are on the heap (If so, maxIndex will be -1 as well).
        Returns:
        Node number in graph or -1

      • getAndRemoveNext

        public int getAndRemoveNext()
        Returns the highest priority (= lowest distance) node from the graph, also removing it from this heap. -1 if no nodes exist in the heap.
        Returns:
        Node number in graph or -1
